item.title: Richard add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "The only infallible truth of our lives is that everything we love in life will be taken from us." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Richard add a quote by Michael Ondaatje
item.description: "...if you do not plunder the past, the absence feeds on you" -- Michael Ondaatje

item.title: Richard add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "The effective object of worship is the bottle and the sole religious experience is that state of uninhibited and belligerent euphoria which follows the ingestion of the third cocktail." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Richard add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Like everyone else on the planet, you believed that time would teach you to grow closer to God. But time doesn't teach; it merely brings us a sense of weariness and of growing older." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Richard add a quote by Tom Wolfe
item.description: "We are all of us doomed to spend our lives watching a movie of our lives - we are always acting on what has just finished happening." -- Tom Wolfe

item.title: Richard add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "More and more, it feels like I'm doing a really bad impersonation of myself." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Richard add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "Of what a strange nature is knowledge! It clings to the mind, when it has once seized on it, like a lichen on the rock. I wished sometimes to shake off all thought and feeling; but I learned that there was but one means to overcome the sensation of pain, and that was death-a state which I feared yet did not understand." -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Richard add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "The snow doesn't give a soft white damn whom it touches." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Richard add a quote by Robert M. Pirsig
item.description: "You are never dedicated to something you have complete confidence in. No one is fanatically shouting that the sun is going to rise tomorrow. They <i>know</i> it's going to rise tomorrow. When people are fanatically dedicated to political or religious faiths or any other kinds of dogmas or goals, it's always because these dogmas or goals are in doubt." -- Robert M. Pirsig

item.title: Richard add a quote by Robert M. Pirsig
item.description: "You look at where you're going and where you are and it never makes much sense, but then you look back at where you've been and a pattern seems to emerge. And if you project forward from that pattern, then sometimes you can come up with something." -- Robert M. Pirsig

item.title: Richard add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Can I get to the bottle of Old Crow and mix it up with the remains of these ice fragments...a cool drink for the freak? Give the gentleman something cool, dear, can't you see he's wired his brain to the water pump and his ears to the generator..." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Richard add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "I said: 'Thou thing of patches, rings, Pins, necklaces and suchlike things, Disguiser of the female form, Thou paltry, gilded poisonous worm!" -- William Blake

item.title: Richard add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Cigars, of course, are made of trail mix, of crushed cashews and Granola and raisins, soaked in maple syrup and dried in the sun. Why not eat one tonight at bedtime?" -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Richard add a quote by Bjorn Kurten
item.description: "None of the dead can rise up and answer our questions. But from all they have left behind, their imperishable and dissolving gear, we may perhaps hear voices, which are only now able to whisper, when everything else has become silent." -- Bjorn Kurten

item.title: Richard add a quote by Chris Marker
item.description: "...he understood there was no way to escape Time, and that this moment he had been granted to watch as a child, which had never ceased to obsess him, was the moment of his own death." -- Chris Marker

item.title: Richard add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "A book no more contains reality than a clock contains time." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Richard add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "As a child, I was an imaginary playmate." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Richard add a quote by China Miéville
item.description: "It felt like being a child again, though it was not. Being a child is like nothing. It's only being. Later, when we think about it, we make it into youth." -- China Miéville

item.title: Richard add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "His time, what a bankrupt idea, as if he’s been given a box of time belonging to him alone, stuffed to the brim with hours and minutes that he can spend like money. Trouble is, the box has holes in it and the time is running out, no matter what he does with it." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Richard add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "When life demands more of people than they demand of life - as is ordinarily the case - what results is a resentment of life that is almost as deep-seated as the fear of death. Indeed, the resentment of life and the fear of death are virtually synonymous. Does it follow, then, that the more people ask of living, the less their fear of dying?" -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Richard add a quote by Bill Withers
item.description: "I'm like pennies in your pocket. You know they're there, but you dont think about them." -- Bill Withers

item.title: Richard add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "I was wise enough never to grow up, while fooling people into believing I had." -- Margaret Mead
